tr.td: Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes)

value.displayName: CONCUSSION WITH BRIEF LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS

translation.displayName: Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes)

code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:white male coachman aged 55 ys presents with severe headache. he also reports moderate nausea, mild vomiting, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the severe headache. a short time ago he sustained a blow to the front of the head (48 min LOC) o:Height 70 in, Weight 201 lbs, Temperature 98.5 F, Pulse 77, SystolicBP 104, DiastolicBP 64, Respiration 14, MRI Brain Unremarkable, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

content2.Unmatched: a short time ago he sustained a blow

Value.Value: MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

content2.Value: MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

td.content: s:55 YO m coachman returns for f/u approx. one (1) week s/p concussion with LOC 48 min. denies vomiting, headache and nausea. First 24-hour hourly checks were without incident. he denies drinking alcohol pt has a one pack per day habit o:Height 71 in, Weight 204 lbs, Temperature 98.7 F, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 15, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=97,Visual Memory=96,Processing Speed=43.0,Reaction Time=0.49, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.
